intro: Hieracium kuekenthalianum subsp. schmidianum, commonly known as the Schmid's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering heads. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its morphology and distribution reflect adaptations to its specific ecological niche.
